title: RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Overview
content: The **RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board** is designed to be compatible with the **Feather format** while leveraging the capabilities of the RAK4260 module. At its core, the board features the RAK4260, a module built around the ATSAMR34J18B SiP. This high level of integration delivers exceptional performance, including LoRa TX power of up to 20dBm.
parent_content:
The **RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board** is designed to be compatible with the **Feather format** while leveraging the capabilities of the RAK4260 module. At its core, the board features the RAK4260, a module built around the ATSAMR34J18B SiP. This high level of integration delivers exceptional performance, including LoRa TX power of up to 20dBm.  
A key feature of this breakout board is the ATECC606A **cryptographic co-processor**, which provides secure, hardware-based key storage. This sets the RAK3244 BastWAN apart from the RAK4200 and RAK4600 by adding an extra layer of security to future-proof your platform.  
The board complies with LoRaWAN 1.0.2 specification, and it also supports LoRa P2P Point-to-Point communication. The low power, long-range LoRa communication capabilities of the board make it suitable for a variety of applications in the IoT field such as home automation, sensor networks, building automation, and personal area networks applications such as health/fitness sensors and monitors.

title: RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > SWD Programming Interface > Connecting DAPLink Tool to RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board
content:
When programming using a DAPLink tool, ensure that all four (4) of the following pins are connected to your DAPLink tool:  
1. **3V3**
2. **SWDIO**
3. **SWCLK**
4. **GND**  
> **TIP:** NOTE
It is recommended to leave these pins exposed for programming purposes and avoid remapping them as GPIOs.  
The proper connection between the DapLink tool and RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board is illustrated in **Figure 4**.  
> **Image:** RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Pinout for DapLink tool
parent_content:
When programming using a DAPLink tool, ensure that all four (4) of the following pins are connected to your DAPLink tool:  
1. **3V3**
2. **SWDIO**
3. **SWCLK**
4. **GND**  
> **TIP:** NOTE
It is recommended to leave these pins exposed for programming purposes and avoid remapping them as GPIOs.  
The proper connection between the DapLink tool and RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board is illustrated in **Figure 4**.  
> **Image:** RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Pinout for DapLink tool

title: RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > I2C Interface > I2C Interface for Cryptographic Applications
content: **I2C_SCL** and **I2C_SDA** are connected to the ATECC608A crypto chip, enabling the development of cryptographic applications such as network end-point key management, small message and PII data encryption, secure boot and protected downloads, ecosystem control, and anti-cloning. Additional I2C peripherals can be integrated using the breakout pins on connector J3.
parent_content: **I2C_SCL** and **I2C_SDA** are connected to the ATECC608A crypto chip, enabling the development of cryptographic applications such as network end-point key management, small message and PII data encryption, secure boot and protected downloads, ecosystem control, and anti-cloning. Additional I2C peripherals can be integrated using the breakout pins on connector J3.

title: RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > RF Interface > RAK4260 RF Pin Connection to SMA Antenna Connector
content: The RF pin of the RAK4260 module is wired to an SMA antenna connector.
parent_content: The RF pin of the RAK4260 module is wired to an SMA antenna connector.

| --- | --- | --- | --------- |
| 1   | RST | -   | MCU reset |

| 3   | GND | -   | GND       |
| 4   | GND | -   | GND       |
| 5   | A0  | I/O | PA09      |
| 6   | A1  | I/O | PA08      |
| 7   | A2  | I/O | PA07      |
| 8   | A3  | I/O | PA06      |
| 9   | A4  | I/O | PA04      |
| 10  | D3  | I/O | PB03      |
| 11  | SCK | I/O | PB23      |
| 12  |MOSI | I/O | PB02      |
| 13  |MISO | I/O | PA23      |

title: RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > RAK3244 BastWAN Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > Operating Frequencies > RAK3244 Breakout Board Supported LoRa Bands [TABLE]
content:
The RAK3244 Breakout Board supports the following LoRa bands:  
| Region | Frequency (MHz) |
|-|-|
| Europe | EU868 |
| North America | US915 |
| Australia | AU915 |
| Asia | AS923 |
